primary_references: Budge, E. A. Wallis. (1904). The Gods of the Egyptians: Or, Studies in Egyptian Mythology.
Hart, George. (2005). The Routledge Dictionary of Egyptian Gods and Goddesses.
major_textual_sources_ancient: Book of the Dead (New Kingdom and later)
museum_collections: The Egyptian Museum, Cairo (Grand Egyptian Museum - GEM)
The British Museum - Ancient Egypt Collection

epithets: King of the Gods (during certain periods)
ra_horakhty.historical_description: Ra (or Re) is one of the most ancient and significant deities, primarily associated with the midday sun.

iconography.form: Man with a falcon head, or a falcon.
iconography.headdress: Sun disk encircled by a cobra (uraeus).

isis.historical_description: Isis (Aset) is a powerful goddess, revered for her magical abilities.

pharaoh_new_kingdom_warrior.historical_description: Pharaohs of the New Kingdom often depicted as conquerors.

perspective_representation.description: Composite perspective (frontal torso, profile head and limbs).
